intro: Orchis robusta, commonly known as the robust orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in woodland or meadow habitats. Its flowers are borne in dense spikes and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Orchis robusta is known for its ability to form clumps over time, making it a long-lived and resilient species.
